page.title: 10CHARLTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall was officially opened in July 1981 by Earl of Suffolk and Berkshire, who became life President of the Hall. Residents of Charlton raised Â£27,000 in four years to build the hall. Small proportion of money came in form of grants from Councils and Sainsbury Trust, but residents worked hard arranging fund raising events such as dances, fetes etc-you name it, they did it. The modern building stands in 7 acres of Recreation Field leased from Lord Suffolk a Â£1 rental per year. Rents paid by organisations and hirers cover running costs and wages for cleaner and caretaker. About four annual fund raising events help pro- vide extra items. Once a month "Friday People" get together for non- profit making social event. Management con- sists reps of organisations + 3 elect.
